page.title: 20THE TOWER, MILLERSTON
page.content: { The Tower}was built in the late 19th century and is a two-storey and attic Baronial-style tower house. It is a category C{Listed Building.} When first built it was surrounded by farm land but gradually this land was used more and more by the local scrap metal yard. The last occupants left in 1975 and since then it has remained vacant. Vandals have broken the windows and two alsation dogs keep further vandals at bay. On both the first floor and attic there are two rooms, one tiny one just over{six feet square,}and a large room with a fire place. Today we find it hard to believe that people could live in such cramped quarters. Our modern houses are a great improvement, even if we do sometimes think the rooms of some mass-produced houses are too small.
